events.originalText: The ferry MV Sewol (pictured) capsized and sank off Donggeochado, South Korea, killing 306 people, mainly students from Danwon High School.
events.subtitle: MV Sewol
events.headline: MV Sewol ferry capsizes off Donggeochado, South Korea, killing 306

events.originalText: In one of the deadliest shooting incidents in United States history, a gunman killed 32 people and wounded over 20 more before committing suicide at the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University in Blacksburg, Virginia (memorial pictured).
events.subtitle: Virginia Tech shooting
events.headline: Gunman kills 32 at Virginia Tech before committing suicide

events.originalText: India and Bangladesh began a six-day conflict over their disputed border, which ended in a stalemate.
events.subtitle: 2001 Bangladesh–India border clashes
events.headline: India and Bangladesh conflict over disputed border ends in stalemate

events.originalText: In response to an open letter written by white clergymen, Martin Luther King Jr. wrote the Letter from Birmingham Jail in defence of the strategy of nonviolent resistance against racism.
events.subtitle: A Call for Unity
events.headline: Martin Luther King Jr. writes Letter from Birmingham Jail

events.originalText: The Organisation for European Economic Co-operation, headquartered in Paris, was founded.
events.subtitle: OECD
events.headline: Organisation for European Economic Co-operation founded in Paris

events.originalText: Second World War: British and Canadian forces concluded the Liberation of Arnhem in the Netherlands from German occupation.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: British and Canadian forces liberate Arnhem from German occupation

events.originalText: Polish–Soviet War: The Polish army launched the Vilna offensive to capture Vilnius (now in Lithuania) from the Red Army.
events.subtitle: Polish–Soviet War
events.headline: Polish army launches Vilna offensive against Red Army

events.originalText: World War I: Several French army corps began a massive assault against the German-occupied Chemin des Dames ridge, south of Laon, France.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: French army assaults German-occupied Chemin des Dames ridge

events.originalText: American pilot Harriet Quimby (pictured)  became the first woman to fly across the English Channel.
events.subtitle: Harriet Quimby
events.headline: Harriet Quimby becomes first woman to fly across English Channel

events.originalText: Slavery in Washington, D.C., ended when the District of Columbia Compensated Emancipation Act became law.
events.subtitle: Washington, D.C.
events.headline: Slavery ends in Washington, D.C. with Compensated Emancipation Act

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: Severely outnumbered French forces repulsed an Ottoman attack at the Battle of Mount Tabor in present-day Israel.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: French forces repel Ottoman attack at Battle of Mount Tabor

events.originalText: A revolt of citizens of Toledo in Castile, opposed to the rule of the foreign-born Charles I, began when the royal government attempted to unseat radical city councilors.
events.subtitle: Revolt of the Comuneros
events.headline: Revolt against foreign-born Charles I begins in Toledo, Castile
